instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00875: What is 820-00875? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H_CPU: What is PPBUS_G3H_CPU? PPBUS_G3H_CPU is the .
definitions.R6905: What is R6905? Resistor between charger voltage and input to PP3V42_G3H power supply on older Macbooks, pre-2011 models. This resistor blows when C6990 has shorted to ground or U6990 has shorted to ground, and will result in PP3V42_G3H missing and the magsafe charger not having a light since PP3V42_G3H is necessary for the SMC to turn on and the onewire circuit to turn on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on shorted <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
No water damage. Short on ppbus. Removed <RESISTOR>R6905</RESISTOR> and checked that short is on pin 1, after that removed <RESISTOR>R5400</RESISTOR> and the short is on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_CPU</SIGNAL>. 

Can i inject to check what is heating up?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on shorted <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Why do not compare that short with CPU coils???
Are you decided to fry the CPU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on shorted <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Definitly i am not decided to fry CPU, this is why i am registered in this forum and asking question to you. 

Still not injected removed <TRANSISTOR>Q7960</TRANSISTOR> and short is gone, after that removed L7960 and short was on second pad ( <SIGNAL>PPVCCIO_S0G</SIGNAL>).  Dead CPU?

Thanks in advance for your help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on shorted <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
So <TRANSISTOR>Q7960</TRANSISTOR> is bad for sure.
You didn't need voltage injection to find it.

What is the exact ohm value to ground at L7960?
Some CPU power rails have low values as normal.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on shorted <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: L7960 on pin 2 <SIGNAL>PPVCCIO_S0G</SIGNAL> is 1.2 ohm. With <TRANSISTOR>Q7960</TRANSISTOR> and L7960 removed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on shorted <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Looks like short for me, as that is not a core rail.
Should be bad CPU.

Just in case, compare with good board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on shorted <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Thanks. Confirmed, it is bad cpu.

have u ever changed one? Can i take from donor board with same cpu?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on shorted <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Didn't change any yet.
You can pick it from any board, or new; just get one with same specs.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on shorted <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: does it have firmware like smc, or just swap?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on shorted <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Embedded PCH, so need to clean ME region at the end.
However, it should boot with original BIOS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on shorted <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: thanks. will try or revive donor board or swap CPU from it. Will post when done

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on shorted <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
